ğŸŒŸ Groovy - a bit of shiny tricks in scripting

  • theory - language specification
  • some snippets in practice

ğŸ¥œ (Apache) Groovy in nutshell ğŸ¥œ

  • groovy is complex: object-oriented, functional ğŸ“Œ, java syntax libraries compatible ğŸ“Œ (and syntax)
  • is able to mix features of dynamically ğŸ“Œ and statically typed language at the same time
  • Abstract Syntax Tree features: operators overloading, native syntax for lists and associative arrays (maps), native support for regular expressions, polymorphic iteration, string interpolation and the safe navigation operator ?., closures ğŸ“Œ

ğŸ¥œ (Apache) Groovy in nutshell ğŸ¥œ

  • used for programming and scripting ğŸ“Œ with features similar to those of Python or Ruby, what makes it very easy to use non-native groovy idioms ğŸ˜•
  • Groovy source code file can be executed as an (uncompiled) script - what means errors during runtime, it could be also compiled statically, but this is not Jenkins case
  • Groovy implicitly generates getters and setters, and allows to construct object with a field -> value map

Jenkins - introduction to pipelines hydrualics

  • Jobs management ğŸ“Œ
  • Extensions
  • Infrastructure

Job management

  • Freestyle - allows to configure manually set of Jenkins API calls into simple job
  • ğŸ“Œ Pipelines - groovy framework for creating CI/CD pipelines which consits of stages executing steps
  • DSL - way to configure any type of the job via Groovy code instead of manual actions
  • Multibranch - group of jobs generated for set of branches in the specified repository

Extensions

  • Plugins - base part of Jenkins ecosystem, java API provided by plugins is accessible on each part of job config - DSL, freestyle and pipelines
  • ğŸ“Œ Libraries - the best way to add custom steps exposed as JVM libraries into your pipelines
  • UI tweaks - editing jobs HTML is the best way to add business crucial features into jenkins

Infrastructure

  • Manual administration - osx, windows, raspberrys, mobiles
  • ğŸ“Œ CCA VMs - 24⁄7 VMs with tool for codified software management (e.g. puppet/chef)
  • ğŸ“Œ On demand VMs - public cloud computing instances spawned only for the time of job execution
  • ğŸ“Œ Containers - containers attached to jenkins via swarm/k8s/docker cli
  • Serverless - FaaS dispatchment, jenkins X, jenkinsfile runner
